column4: i am running testdisk, and it finds the damaged fat32 partition (it doesnt let me view any of the files, it says its damaged)
what is the best way to go about fixing it
just out of curiosity.. did you install testdisk from the 7.04 live cd? or the package dvd?
i downloaded, and transfered it using my mp3 player
ok, thanks
there seems to some info here http://www.cgsecurity.org/wiki/TestDisk
they even have recovery examples on that wiki
yeah i am looking at it, i just dont really know which one is my problem even
you upgraded and the partition is gone, right?
yes
i see a fat32 partition in there, and i cant list the files, it says partition damaged
resized? you chose this during the upgrade? or it did it by itself?
i chose it during upgrade, 200 gigs to my new partition and the other information to be resized to the other 200 gigs of the drive
ah.. so you did a new install.. not an upgrade.. and created a new partition by moving the existing partitions towards the end of the drive.. and this somehow killed one of the partitions?
strange.. I've always thought the ubuntu installer was pretty good with these things.. never had it mess up like this.
ok.. were you able to run testdisk? did it create a log? could you pastebin the log?
where is the log stored?
http://www.pastebin.org/12131
did you try listing the files in the found fat32 partition using testdisk?
it didn't offer any other options after that?
well.. I don't think I can do you any good.. I don't see any obvious solutions.. is the data lost valuable enough to send the drive to one of those data-rescue-companies?
